column1:
What is the primary purpose of the Application Plugin in Gradle?

A. To create an executable JVM application
B. To manage database connections
C. To optimize application performance
D. To facilitate web application development
column2:
Correct Answer: A

The primary purpose of the Application Plugin in Gradle is to facilitate the creation of an executable JVM application. It simplifies the process of starting the application during development and packaging it for distribution, including necessary scripts and dependencies.

column1:
Which of the following is a mandatory configuration when using the Application Plugin?

A. Specifying the main class of the application
B. Defining the database connection settings
C. Setting up a user interface framework
D. Configuring network protocols
column2:
Correct Answer: A

When using the Application Plugin, the only mandatory configuration is specifying the main class, which serves as the entry point for the application. This is essential for the plugin to know which class to execute when the application is run.

column1:
What task is used to run the application defined by the Application Plugin?

A. build
B. run
C. install
D. package
column2:
Correct Answer: B

The task used to run the application defined by the Application Plugin is the 'run' task. This task compiles the main source set and launches a new JVM with the specified main class and its runtime dependencies.

column1:
What does the Application Plugin automatically apply when it is used?

A. Java plugin and Distribution plugin
B. Web plugin and Database plugin
C. Testing plugin and Reporting plugin
D. Security plugin and Performance plugin
column2:
Correct Answer: A

When the Application Plugin is applied, it automatically applies both the Java plugin and the Distribution plugin. This ensures that the application can be built and packaged correctly, including all necessary dependencies and scripts.

column1:
What is the primary purpose of the Application plugin in Gradle?

A. To create an executable JVM application
B. To manage database connections
C. To optimize application performance
D. To facilitate web application development
column2:
Correct Answer: A

The primary purpose of the Application plugin in Gradle is to facilitate the creation of executable JVM applications. It simplifies the process of starting the application during development and packaging it for distribution, ensuring that all necessary components are included.

column1:
Which of the following is a mandatory configuration when using the Application plugin?

A. Specifying the main class of the application
B. Defining the database schema
C. Setting up a web server
D. Configuring user authentication
column2:
Correct Answer: A

When using the Application plugin, the only mandatory configuration is specifying the main class, which serves as the entry point for the application. This is essential for the application to run correctly.

column1:
What command is used to run the application defined by the Application plugin?

A. gradle build
B. gradle run
C. gradle start
D. gradle execute
column2:
Correct Answer: B

The command used to run the application defined by the Application plugin is 'gradle run'. This command compiles the main source set and launches a new JVM with the specified main class and its runtime dependencies.

column1:
What does the 'installDist' task do in the context of the Application plugin?

A. Creates a ZIP archive of the application
B. Installs the application into a specified directory
C. Runs the application in debug mode
D. Generates start scripts for the application
column2:
Correct Answer: B

'installDist' is a task that installs the application into a specified directory. This task ensures that all necessary files, including runtime libraries and start scripts, are placed in the correct location for easy execution.

column1:
What is the primary requirement for configuring the Application plugin in a build script?

A. Specifying the main class of the application
B. Defining the version of the application
C. Setting up a database connection
D. Choosing the programming language for the application
column2:
Correct Answer: A

The primary requirement for configuring the Application plugin is to specify the main class of the application, which serves as the entry point for execution. This configuration is essential for the plugin to know which class to run when the application is executed.

column1:
How can you run an application configured with the Application plugin?

A. By executing the 'build' task
B. By executing the 'run' task
C. By executing the 'install' task
D. By executing the 'package' task
column2:
Correct Answer: B

To run an application configured with the Application plugin, you execute the 'run' task. This task compiles the main source set and launches a new JVM with the specified main class and its runtime dependencies.

column1:
What is the purpose of the 'applicationDefaultJvmArgs' property in the Application plugin?

A. To specify the main class of the application
B. To define the default JVM settings for the application
C. To set the output directory for the application
D. To configure the application version
column2:
Correct Answer: B

The 'applicationDefaultJvmArgs' property is used to define the default JVM settings that will be applied when running the application. This allows developers to specify JVM arguments that should be used consistently across different runs of the application.

column1:
What happens if the main class is not specified in the Application plugin configuration?

A. The application will run with a default main class
B. An error will occur when trying to run the application
C. The application will compile but not execute
D. The application will run in a debug mode automatically
column2:
Correct Answer: B

If the main class is not specified in the Application plugin configuration, an error will occur when trying to run the application. The main class is essential for the plugin to know which entry point to execute, and without it, the application cannot be launched.

column1:
What is the purpose of passing command line arguments when running an application using the Application plugin?

A. To specify the main class of the application
B. To provide additional input to the application at runtime
C. To configure the build script for the application
D. To define the output directory for the application
column2:
Correct Answer: B

Command line arguments are used to provide additional input to the application at runtime. This allows users to customize the behavior of the application without modifying the code or build script. For example, arguments can be used to specify options or parameters that the application should process during execution.

column1:
How can command line arguments be passed to an application when using Gradle?

A. By modifying the build.gradle file directly
B. By using the `--args` option in the run command
C. By setting environment variables before running the application
D. By including them in the `mainClass` configuration
column2:
Correct Answer: B

Command line arguments can be passed to an application using the `--args` option in the run command. This allows users to specify the arguments they want the application to receive when it is executed, enabling dynamic input during runtime.

column1:
What happens if command line arguments are not specified when running an application?

A. The application will not run at all
B. The application will run with default settings or values
C. The application will throw an error
D. The application will ignore all input
column2:
Correct Answer: B

If command line arguments are not specified when running an application, the application will typically run with default settings or values. This means that it will execute without any additional input, relying on predefined configurations or hardcoded values within the application.

column1:
What is the purpose of configuring JVM settings in an application built with the Application plugin?

A. To define the main class of the application
B. To specify the runtime environment and performance options for the JVM
C. To create start scripts for the application
D. To package the application into a distribution format
column2:
Correct Answer: B

Configuring JVM settings allows developers to specify runtime environment options and performance parameters for the Java Virtual Machine (JVM) when running the application. This can include memory settings, system properties, and other configurations that affect how the application runs.

column1:
Which property is used to set default JVM arguments for an application in Gradle?

A. applicationMainClass
B. applicationDefaultJvmArgs
C. applicationExecutableDir
D. applicationDistribution
column2:
Correct Answer: B

The property 'applicationDefaultJvmArgs' is used to configure default JVM arguments that are applied when running the application. This ensures that the specified settings are consistently used across different execution contexts, including when generating start scripts.

column1:
How can command line arguments be passed to a JVM application using Gradle?

A. By modifying the main class configuration
B. By using the --args option with the run task
C. By setting the applicationDefaultJvmArgs property
D. By including them in the build.gradle file
column2:
Correct Answer: B

Command line arguments can be passed to a JVM application in Gradle by using the --args option with the run task. This allows developers to specify runtime parameters that the application can utilize during execution.

column1:
What happens if the JVM settings are not configured for an application using the Application plugin?

A. The application will not compile
B. The application will run with default JVM settings
C. The application will fail to package correctly
D. The application will not generate start scripts
column2:
Correct Answer: B

If JVM settings are not configured, the application will run with the default JVM settings provided by the Java Virtual Machine. This means that while the application can still execute, it may not be optimized for performance or specific runtime requirements.

column1:
What is the primary purpose of the Distribution plugin in the context of application development?

A. To create a runnable executable from the application code
B. To package the application along with its runtime dependencies
C. To manage the application's source code versioning
D. To optimize the application's performance during execution
column2:
Correct Answer: B

The primary purpose of the Distribution plugin is to package the application along with its runtime dependencies into a distributable format. This includes creating a directory structure that contains the necessary files for running the application, such as libraries and start scripts, making it easy to deploy and execute the application on different systems.

column1:
Which of the following is included in the main distribution created by the Application plugin?

A. Source code files
B. Configuration files only
C. All runtime dependencies and main source set class files
D. Only the executable JAR file
column2:
Correct Answer: C

The main distribution created by the Application plugin includes all runtime dependencies and the main source set class files. This ensures that when the application is distributed, it contains everything needed to run it, including the necessary libraries and resources.

column1:
What command can be used to create a ZIP archive of the application distribution?

A. gradle buildZip
B. gradle distZip
C. gradle createZip
D. gradle packageZip
column2:
Correct Answer: B

The command 'gradle distZip' is used to create a ZIP archive of the application distribution. This command packages the application along with its runtime libraries and start scripts into a single ZIP file, making it easy to share and deploy the application.

column1:
What is a key requirement for customizing the content of the application distribution?

A. The application must be written in Java
B. Static files must be added to a specific directory
C. The application must use the Java Module System
D. The distribution must include a README file
column2:
Correct Answer: B

To customize the content of the application distribution, static files can be added to the 'src/dist' directory. This allows developers to include additional resources or files that should be part of the distribution package, ensuring that all necessary components are included when the application is distributed.

column1:
What is the primary purpose of the start scripts generated by the Application plugin?

A. To launch a JVM with the specified settings for the application
B. To compile the application source code
C. To package the application into a ZIP file
D. To manage dependencies for the application
column2:
Correct Answer: A

The primary purpose of the start scripts generated by the Application plugin is to launch a JVM with the specified settings defined in the build script. These scripts facilitate the execution of the application in the appropriate runtime environment.

column1:
Which of the following statements is true regarding the customization of start scripts?

A. Start scripts cannot be customized and are fixed.
B. Start scripts can be customized based on user-defined templates.
C. Start scripts are only generated for Unix-based systems.
D. Start scripts are generated only for Windows systems.
column2:
Correct Answer: B

Start scripts can be customized based on user-defined templates. The Application plugin provides flexibility in modifying the default script templates to suit specific requirements, allowing for a tailored execution environment.

column1:
What is a necessary step to ensure the start scripts function correctly?

A. The application must be compiled before generating start scripts.
B. The start scripts must be manually edited after generation.
C. The application must be packaged into a JAR file before generating start scripts.
D. The start scripts require a specific naming convention to work.
column2:
Correct Answer: A

To ensure the start scripts function correctly, the application must be compiled before generating the start scripts. This is because the scripts depend on the compiled classes and runtime dependencies to execute the application properly.

column1:
Which task is responsible for creating the OS-specific start scripts in a Gradle project using the Application plugin?

A. run
B. startScripts
C. installDist
D. distZip
column2:
Correct Answer: B

The task responsible for creating the OS-specific start scripts in a Gradle project using the Application plugin is the 'startScripts' task. This task generates the necessary scripts to run the application on different operating systems.

column1:
What is a key requirement for building applications using the Java Module System in Gradle?

A. Creating a `module-info.java` file
B. Using only Java 8 features
C. Defining all classes in a single package
D. Avoiding the use of external libraries
column2:
Correct Answer: A

A key requirement for building applications using the Java Module System in Gradle is the creation of a `module-info.java` file. This file describes the application module and its dependencies, which is essential for modular applications to function correctly.

column1:
When using the Application plugin with a modular application, what additional information must be provided to Gradle?

A. The version of the Java Development Kit
B. The name of the module to run along with the main class name
C. The location of the source files
D. The maximum heap size for the JVM
column2:
Correct Answer: B

When using the Application plugin with a modular application, you must provide the name of the module to run in addition to the main class name. This ensures that Gradle can correctly identify and execute the modular application while respecting module boundaries.

column1:
What happens if a modular application attempts reflective access to an internal package from another module?

A. It will succeed without any issues.
B. It will result in a runtime error.
C. It will be ignored by the JVM.
D. It will compile but fail at runtime.
column2:
Correct Answer: B

If a modular application attempts reflective access to an internal package from another module, it will result in a runtime error. This is due to the strict encapsulation enforced by the Java Module System, which prevents unauthorized access to internal packages.

column1:
What is the purpose of the `applicationDefaultJvmArgs` property in a Gradle application?

A. To specify the main class of the application
B. To define default JVM settings for the run task
C. To list all dependencies of the application
D. To configure the output directory for build artifacts
column2:
Correct Answer: B

The `applicationDefaultJvmArgs` property in a Gradle application is used to define default JVM settings for the run task. These settings are applied when the application is executed, allowing developers to customize the JVM environment for their application.

column1:
What is the primary purpose of Gradle tasks in the context of the Application plugin?

A. To define the structure of the application code
B. To automate the build and execution processes of the application
C. To manage the application's database connections
D. To create user interfaces for the application
column2:
Correct Answer: B

The primary purpose of Gradle tasks in the context of the Application plugin is to automate the build and execution processes of the application. Tasks such as 'run', 'installDist', and 'distZip' facilitate various stages of application development, from compiling code to packaging and running the application.

column1:
Which of the following tasks is responsible for creating OS-specific scripts to run the application?

A. run
B. startScripts
C. installDist
D. distZip
column2:
Correct Answer: B

The 'startScripts' task is responsible for creating OS-specific scripts that allow the application to be run as a JVM application. This task generates the necessary scripts based on the settings defined in the build configuration, ensuring compatibility with different operating systems.

column1:
What does the 'installDist' task do in the Gradle Application plugin?

A. Creates a ZIP archive of the application
B. Installs the application into a specified directory
C. Compiles the application code
D. Generates start scripts for the application
column2:
Correct Answer: B

'installDist' is a task that installs the application into a specified directory. This task ensures that all necessary files, including runtime libraries and start scripts, are placed in the correct location for easy access and execution.

column1:
Which task would you use to create a full distribution ZIP archive of your application?

A. distTar
B. distZip
C. run
D. startScripts
column2:
Correct Answer: B

The 'distZip' task is used to create a full distribution ZIP archive of the application. This task packages the application along with its runtime libraries and OS-specific scripts, making it easy to distribute and deploy the application.

column1:
What is the primary purpose of the Application extension in Gradle?

A. To configure the behavior of the application plugin
B. To manage database connections
C. To optimize the performance of the JVM
D. To create user interfaces for applications
column2:
Correct Answer: A

The primary purpose of the Application extension in Gradle is to configure the behavior of the application plugin. This extension allows developers to specify various properties and settings that affect how the application is built and run, ensuring that the application meets specific requirements.

column1:
How can developers customize the Application extension in their build script?

A. By using the `application {}` block
B. By modifying the `settings.gradle` file
C. By creating a new Gradle project
D. By using the `dependencies {}` block
column2:
Correct Answer: A

Developers can customize the Application extension in their build script by using the `application {}` block. This block allows them to set various properties related to the application, such as the main class, executable directory, and default JVM arguments, thereby tailoring the build process to their needs.

column1:
What type of properties does the Application extension provide for configuration?

A. Runtime environment variables
B. Build script properties
C. Application-specific settings
D. Database connection strings
column2:
Correct Answer: C

The Application extension provides application-specific settings for configuration. These settings allow developers to define how the application should behave during the build and execution phases, including specifying the main class and other relevant parameters that are crucial for the application's operation.

column1:
Which of the following is NOT a feature of the Application extension?

A. Configuring the main class of the application
B. Setting default JVM arguments
C. Managing user authentication
D. Customizing the executable directory for start scripts
column2:
Correct Answer: C

Managing user authentication is not a feature of the Application extension. The Application extension focuses on configuring aspects related to building and running JVM applications, such as specifying the main class, setting default JVM arguments, and customizing the directory for start scripts, but it does not handle user authentication.
